author: Special Correspondent
text:
Gold jewellery weighing more than 20 sovereigns were stolen in three incidents of burglary in the city on Saturday.

In the first incident, reported under Avaniapuram police station limits, the house of Karuppayee at Tamil Nadu Housing Board Colony in Mela Anuppanadi was broken into. The aged woman had left for her native place in Kamudhi on Tuesday and returned home on Saturday.

The culprits had gained entry into the house by breaking open the rear door and took away an LCD television set, 500 grams of silver articles, two sovereigns of gold and Rs. 10,000.

In the next incident reported at Ramalinga Nagar in HMS Colony, the house of a retired senior Deputy Registrar of Madurai Kamaraj University, Albert Karunakaran (59), was broken into and 17 sovereigns of gold stolen. The family members had gone to Karaikudi to attend a funeral on Friday. SS Colony police are investigating.

In the third incident, one and a half sovereigns of gold was stolen from the residence of I. Durairaj (54) of Pamban Nagar near Uchaparambumedu. Tallakulam police are investigating.
title: 20 sovereigns stolen in three incidents
